segment.source: title: Setup Windows Containers in place
segment.target: title: Setup Windows Containers in place

segment.source: Preparing a physical machine or an existing virtual machine for Windows Server Containers
segment.target: Preparing a physical machine or an existing virtual machine for Windows Server Containers

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.
segment.target: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.

segment.source: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers on bare metal or in an existing virtual machine running Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview.
segment.target: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers on bare metal or in an existing virtual machine running Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview.

segment.source: Other getting started guides:
segment.target: Other getting started guides:

segment.source: Run Windows Server Containers in Azure.
segment.target: Run Windows Server Containers in Azure.

segment.source: Run Windows Server Containers in a new Hyper-V VM.
segment.target: Run Windows Server Containers in a new Hyper-V VM.

segment.source: PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE: The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).
segment.target: PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE: The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).

segment.source: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.
segment.target: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.

segment.source: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.
segment.target: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.

segment.source: System (or VM) requirements:
segment.target: System (or VM) requirements:

segment.source: System running Windows Server Technical Preview 3 Server Core.
segment.target: System running Windows Server Technical Preview 3 Server Core.

segment.source: 10GB available storage for OS Base Image and setup scripts.
segment.target: 10GB available storage for OS Base Image and setup scripts.

segment.source: Administrator permissions on the machine or VM.
segment.target: Administrator permissions on the machine or VM.

segment.source: Setup an existing Virtual Machine or Bare Metal host for Containers
segment.target: Setup an existing Virtual Machine or Bare Metal host for Containers

segment.source: Windows Server Containers require the Container OS Base Image.
segment.target: Windows Server Containers require the Container OS Base Image.

segment.source: We have put together a script that will download and install this for you.
segment.target: We have put together a script that will download and install this for you.

segment.source: Follow these steps to configure your system as a Windows Server Container Host.
segment.target: Follow these steps to configure your system as a Windows Server Container Host.

segment.source: Start a PowerShell session as administrator.
segment.target: Start a PowerShell session as administrator.

segment.source: This can be done by running the following command from the command line.
segment.target: This can be done by running the following command from the command line.

segment.source: Make sure the title of the windows is "Administrator: Windows PowerShell".
segment.target: Make sure the title of the windows is "Administrator: Windows PowerShell".

segment.source: If it does not say Administrator, run this command to run with admin priveledges:
segment.target: If it does not say Administrator, run this command to run with admin priveledges:

segment.source: Use the following command to download the setup script.
segment.target: Use the following command to download the setup script.

segment.source: The script can also be manually downloaded from this location - Configuration Script.
segment.target: The script can also be manually downloaded from this location - Configuration Script.

segment.source: After the download completes, execute the script.
segment.target: After the download completes, execute the script.

segment.source: The script will then begin to download and configure the Windows Server Container components.
segment.target: The script will then begin to download and configure the Windows Server Container components.

segment.source: This process may take quite some time due to the large download.
segment.target: This process may take quite some time due to the large download.

segment.source: The machine may reboot during the process.
segment.target: The machine may reboot during the process.

segment.source: When finished your machine will be configured and ready for you to create and manage Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container Images with both PowerShell and Docker.
segment.target: When finished your machine will be configured and ready for you to create and manage Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container Images with both PowerShell and Docker.

segment.source: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.
segment.target: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.

segment.source: Next Steps - Start Using Containers
segment.target: Next Steps - Start Using Containers

segment.source: Now that you are running Windows Server Containers, jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
segment.target: Now that you are running Windows Server Containers, jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.

segment.target: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and Docker
